main_definition: Was is the past tense of the verb 'to be' in English, used to indicate a state or condition that existed at some point in the past.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Existence or occurrence in the past
meanings_and_examples.example: The dinosaurs were dominant creatures millions of years ago.

meanings_and_examples.definition: State or condition previously held by someone/something
meanings_and_examples.example: She was tired after a long day at work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To have been in the past, often used with perfect tenses to indicate an action that started and ended in the past
meanings_and_examples.example: He had been working on his project for three days before it was completed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Past participle of 'be' when used as part of the verb phrase 'was going', indicating a continuous action or state in the past
meanings_and_examples.example: She was going to visit her grandmother last weekend, but she couldn't make it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used with infinitives to form the present perfect tense, often conveying an action that started in the past and has relevance or consequence in the present
meanings_and_examples.example: I have been learning Spanish for six months now.
